intro: Galipea trifoliata, commonly known as the three-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Galipea trifoliata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
